subject: Physical Fitness
title: Athlete's Heart
description: A fast breakdown of Athlete's Heart for builders.

hook.text: An endurance athlete's heart is visibly larger on a scan. It looks diseased â€” but it's a sign of fitness.

buildup.text: Years of training enlarge the left ventricle. The walls thicken slightly, and the chamber grows wider.

discovery.text: A bigger chamber holds more blood per beat. Stroke volume rises and resting heart rate drops.

twist.text: This adaptation can mimic heart disease on tests. Doctors must distinguish athlete's heart from pathology.

climax.text: It's completely reversible. Stop training for months and the heart returns to normal size.

punchline.text: A bigger heart isn't always disease. Sometimes it's just fitness.

quiz.question: What causes 'athlete's heart'?
options: Years of endurance training enlarge the left ventricle
